'''Salazzle''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''エンニュート''' ''Ennewt'') is a dual-type {{2t|Poison|Fire}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation VII]].

It [[Evolution|evolves]] from a [[Gender|female]] {{p|Salandit}} starting at [[level]] 33.

==Biology==
Salazzle is a dark grey Pokémon resembling a salamander or a lizard. It has a thin dark grey body with a purple underside. Its head is dark grey with purple eyes and slit pupils. There are several tooth-like protrusions on the lower jaw. Salazzle's body has three pink markings, one on the chest, which splits to form a 'U' shaped design, and the other two on the abdomen, forming two 'f'-shaped patterns. Salazzle has a long, dark grey tail with a pink underside and two protrusions come out form the tail's base. It has hands and feet with five digits each. These digits are long and thin. Salazzle is a female-only species. 

It creates a reverse harem with the male {{p|Salandit}} it lives with. It attracts Salandit with its pheromones and forces them to serve it, punishing those unable to give it food with a flame-spewed slap.

==In the anime==
[[File:Lusamine Salazzle.png|thumb|left|250px|Salazzle in the anime]]
===Major appearances===
Salazzle debuted in [[SM053]], under the ownership of [[Lusamine]]. With both Salazzle and her {{pkmn|Trainer}} under the influence of a {{p|Nihilego}}, {{an|Kiawe}} volunteered to stay behind and battle Salazzle while {{Ash}} and {{ashfr|the others}} continued their pursuit atop [[Nebby]].

==In the manga==
===In the Pokémon Adventures manga===
[[File:Team Skull Salazzle Adventures.png|thumb|150px|right|Salazzle in [[Pokémon Adventures]]]]
Salazzle debuted in [[PASM11]]. Two were used by some {{tc|Team Skull Grunt}}s to attack {{adv|Sun}} and his friends at [[Memorial Hill]].

[[Plumeria]]'s Salazzle first appeared in the {{chap|Sun & Moon}}, attacking [[Gladion]] and his {{p|Type: Null}}.

==Trivia==
* No other Pokémon has the same [[type]] [[List of Pokémon with unique type combinations|combination]] as Salazzle and its {{p|Salandit|pre-evolution}}.
** Salazzle and its pre-evolution are also the only {{type|Poison}} Pokémon with a double resistance to {{type|Fairy}} moves.

===Origin===
Salazzle appears to be based on a salamander and lizards of the {{wp|Teiidae}} family, also known as "whiptails". Certain whiptail species have a mostly female population, some species even being female exclusive, one of which is the {{wp|New Mexico whiptail}}. It may also be partially based of {{wp|fire belly newts}}.
====Name origin====
Salazzle may be a combination of ''salamander''<!--please DO NOT add salacious--> and ''dazzle'' or ''sizzle''.

Ennewt may be a combination of 炎 ''en'' (flame) or 艶 ''en'' (bewitching) and ''newt''.
